parameterSetTooltip: From the Parameter Set list, select the customized parameter set that is to be apply by default.
isLockedTooltip: Indicates to lock this selection and consequently make this parameter set disappear from the web app preferences
Info: Do your customized attribute selection and click ok. It will save the parameters in the database.
Info_WebAppsParamSet_modal: Define the Parameter Set to be used in the respective application
Info_Color_modal: Customize how each graphical element of Process Flow Diagram should look based on attribute value of the object. Color corresponding to first matching condition in the table will be used.
Info_Attributes_modal: Define the content of each tile in Process Flow Diagram. Value of selected attribute will be displayed in the same order as seen in this table (first row will be header of the tile)
Info_AspectRatios_modal: Define custom aspect ratio by providing a name and specifying its width and height
Info_TranslationLanguages_modal: Define list of languages to be available in Translation widget
Info_TranslationAttributes_modal: Define list of attributes to be translated
typeTooltip: Type of object for which color needs to be set based on attribute matching the condition
graphicalElementTooltip: Graphical element for which color needs to be set based on attribute matching the condition
attributeNameTooltipForColorModal: Attribute to use to check for necessary condition
attributeValueTooltip: Value that the selected attribute should be checked for given condition
attributeNameTooltipForAttributesModal: Select the Attribute whose value needs to be displayed in Process Flow Diagram tile
rowIndexToolTip: Index of the Row to display attriute - an integer value
maxWidthTooltip: Maximum width (in percentage) that can be occupied by value of this attribute. Meant to be used when more than one attribute needs to be displayed on same row
mergeWithPreviousRowTooltip: Enable to merge value of this attribute with previous attribute defined in the table
displayAttributeTooltip: Enable to display the name of the attribute along with its value
LanguageNameTooltip: Select Language from list of Languages
CorpusTypeTooltip: Corpus Type Process, Item or Resource
IncludeAllAttributesTooltip: Include All Attributes for the selected type
AttributeTooltip: Select the Attribute whose value should be translated
ErrorMsgNameAlreadyUsed: Entered value for %1 is already used, Please choose a different name
ErrorMsgNotANumber: Entered value for %1 is not a number
ErrorMsgNotInRange: Entered value for %1 is not in allowed range
ErrorMsgNotAString: Entered value is not a String
ErrorMsgNotAnInteger: Entered value is not an integer
ErrorMsgLanguageAlreadyUsed: Selected %1 is already used, Please choose a different %1
includeAllAttributesDisabled: Include All Attributes is disabled because one or more attributes for the %1 type have already been added.
